title: Railworks TS2014 AP Class 319/325 Sound Pack
description:
Armstrong Powerhouse presents a sound pack for the class 319 & 325 electric multiple units.

This pack features:

Carefully engineered traction motor sounds

Distinctive clunk and initial whine when applying power

Bogie run sounds to give the sensation of movement

Grinding of the third rail shoe at low speeds and clatter at high speed

User operable two-tone horn using the space-bar and 'B' key

Motor alternator whine on the TSOL coach

Compressor

Cab instrument sounds

External sounds and wind audible from the cab when the driver's window is open (class 319 only)

Realistic sound fading effects

Accurate volume levels. This means the quietest sounds are as quiet as they should be in relation to the loudest as per reality.

Separate internal and external versions of all relevent sounds

1 hour 30 minute scenario for the London to Brighton route which sees you drive two First Capital Connect liveried class 319s between Brighton and Streatham via Redhill.

Improved acceleration physics

If all of that wasn't enough, we have gone beyond just sounds and also implemented some brand new features:

Driver only operation (DOO)

Wheelslip protection when accelerating and braking

In-game power source change (AC/DC)

Player changeable destination blind

4-step reverser (off/forward/neutral/reverse) with AWS & DVD self-test

Opening cab windows (class 319 only)
Essential Requirements

RS.com First Capital Connect Class 319 - More Information

AND/OR

RS.com Class 325 - More Information

Scenario Requirements

Please note that these items are only required if you would like to use the scenario supplied with this pack. If you only want to make use of the sounds or perhaps use them in your own scenarios instead of the included one, then these items are not required.


RS.com European Community Asset Pack

RS.com First Capital Connect Class 319 

RS.com London to Brighton

Thomson Interactive Class 455 


SEEED AND ENJOYYYYYYYY PEOPLEEEEEEE!!!!!
